metadata.feature_description: Generate and manage page thumbnails in different sizes

steps.action: Navigate to Pages panel in PersonaBar and select Home page
steps.expected: Medium-sized thumbnail (120x105) should be displayed in page details panel
steps.actual: Medium thumbnail displayed correctly in the page details panel showing a preview of the page content with Cavalier branding

steps.action: Click on the thumbnail image in the page details panel
steps.actual: Large preview opened showing full page preview with Cavalier header, navigation (HOME, OUR PRODUCTS, NEWS, COMMUNITY), trial notice, and footer

steps.action: Select 404 Error Page in the page list to view its thumbnail
steps.expected: Page should display either a generated thumbnail or fallback thumbnail image
steps.actual: 404 Error Page displayed with a thumbnail showing page preview structure (header area and content area visible), demonstrating the thumbnail generation or fallback system works

steps.action: Click on Small Icon browse button in page details
steps.expected: File chooser dialog should open allowing image upload
steps.actual: File chooser dialog opened successfully, accepting image formats (png, jpg, jpeg, bmp, gif, svg). The upload UI functionality is present and accessible through the Small Icon and Large Icon sections in page details.

observations: The thumbnail system supports four sizes: XSmall (48x42), Small (60x53), Medium (120x105), and Large (640x480)
Thumbnails are stored in the portal's Thumbnails folder with naming convention: {size}_{tabId}_{uniqueId}_{cultureCode}.png
Pages with URL, Tab (Existing), or File page types display special icons (page_link.svg, page_existing.svg, page_file.svg) instead of generated thumbnails
The default fallback thumbnail (fallback-thumbnail.png) is displayed when no custom thumbnail exists for normal pages
Thumbnail generation is handled via html2canvas library which captures page screenshots and sends them to the CreateThumbnails API endpoint
Small Icon and Large Icon in the UI are page icons for menu navigation, separate from the auto-generated page thumbnails
